title: The Dust Bowl Economy
description: A fast breakdown of The Dust Bowl Economy for builders.

hook.text: Economic depression met environmental disaster. Farms blew away as topsoil turned to dust.

buildup.text: Aggressive farming practices stripped the Great Plains of protective grass. Then drought hit.

discovery.text: Dust storms buried towns and destroyed harvests. 2.5 million people fled the Plains states.

twist.text: The Dust Bowl wasn't just a natural disaster. It was an economic one â€” created by bad land incentives.

climax.text: It led to soil conservation programs and showed how economic incentives shape environmental outcomes.

punchline.text: Bad economics can create environmental catastrophe.

quiz.question: What caused the Dust Bowl?
options: Over-farming stripped protective vegetation, then drought hit
